text: Madeley is a town and civil parish in Shropshire, England. It is in the borough of Telford and Wrekin and is now part of the new town of Telford. In 2001, the town had a population of 17,935 people. Madeley is recorded in the Domesday Book as a small settlement. A part of the Ironbridge Gorge, a UNESCO World Heritage Site, is in the civil parish. ==Gallery== File:St_Michaels_Church_-_geograph.org.uk_-_722123.jpg|St Michael's Church File:Madeley_Court_-_geograph.org.uk_-_173588_-_edited.jpg|Madeley Court Gatehouse File:Britannia_Inn_-_geograph.org.uk_-_698314.jpg|Britannia Inn Category:Towns in Shropshire Category:Civil parishes in Shropshire
title: Madeley, Shropshire
